result.execSummary:
The defendant Ezequiel Gomez de la Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ezequiel Gomez de la Cruz

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM Defendant Ezequiel Gomez de la Cruz in court with attorney Erika L Bierma and interpreter Liesel M (sworn).  Defendant Ezequiel Gomez de la Cruz in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court notes parties informed him the matter is resolved and the State states the joint recommendation.  Atty Bierma is in agreement.  DE also agrees.  Court grants State's motion to amend Ct 1 to a misd and advises DE of charge/max penalty.  DE pleads guilty.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds DE guilty.  State makes statement on behalf of the joint agreement.  Atty Bierma makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  Amended to Misd. FTR - 946.425(1m)(a) - Guilty
56 days jail - consecutive to any other
56 days credit for TIME SERVED
$443.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided

Adjustment Number: 22A 000867,
Payable Number: 246834,
Receipt Number: 22R 001156,
Amount: $20.00
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.

01:20 PM Defendant Ezequiel Gomez de la Cruz in court, in custody w/interpreter Fred S. without counsel.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   DE recv'd offer. DE is trying to get atty. Off record to call PD's office.  Back on record DE wants to hire private counsel.  Accomplish within the next month or so.  Court advises right to atty.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Pre-trial conference on December 22, 2021 at 10:00 am.
Return date on January 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:05 PM Defendant Ezequiel Gomez de la Cruz by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Allison A Markoski by Zoom audio and video and Interpreter, Fred S - S&T by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Ezequiel Gomez de la Cruz in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person and by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  Atty Markoski updates DE's address.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $2,500 cash bond.  Atty Markoski recommends $250 cash bond.  Break out room at 3:26 p.m.  Back on the record at 3:29 p.m.  $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 22, 2021 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for January 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
